main event: On June 18, 1949, in Montgomery, Alabama, a civilian reported sighting 20-25 saucer-like objects flying at an altitude of over 500 feet and maneuvering around large thunderhead clouds for approximately 5 minutes.
interesting points: The observer reported the objects to be saucer-like and the size of a dinner plate, with an aluminum color and slower speed than an airplane.
Weather records from the same day indicated scattered clouds at 15,000-18,000 feet with visibility of 10 miles and 4-6 knot winds from the north or west.
The witness, who was the wife of a person in the Air Force, did not notify authorities sooner due to fear of unfavorable publicity.
No photographs or sketches of the objects were provided, and there were no other witnesses to the incident.
The objects were seen maneuvering extremely and bubbling up and down around the large thunderhead clouds, and no sound or odor was detected.
